Hello Gordon,

>
> What Java VM?
> 

My java -version output is as follows:=


java version "1.6.0_20"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_20-b=
02)
Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 16.3-b01, mixed mode)

> The initial =
error you reported is suggestive that there was some 
> corruption in the B=
DB database files, which caused an earlier exception 
> that fouled the env=
ironment. Then, a later operation got the error you 
> excerpted.
> 
> So, =
finding the first exception will give the best clue as to what went 
> wron=
g -- but it could have been some random/arbitrary error like 
> RAM/IO-bus/=
disk flakiness.
> 

It possibly looks like a random/arbitary error. I have =
not faced that error again.


> There's not yet any in-UI facility for comp=
letely deleting a job. The 
> safest approach at this time would be (1) qui=
t the Heritrix JVM at a 
> convenient time; (2) delete the job(s) files/dir=
ectories; (3) restart 
> the Heritrix JVM.

Thanks! I will follow this whil=
e deleting jobs.

As for restarting Heritrix, presently I kill the process =
with the pid in heritrix.pid file and restart it.

Is this the right way of=
 doing it?

Thanks,
Sriram.



--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gord=
on Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:


> You can move jobs directories around, but s=

he job directories and job 
> files it's already discovered to be changed o=
utside its own operations.
> 

> 
> - Gordon @ IA
